{"step_by_step_thinking": "First, we need to know that Pseudomonas and Proteus are both gram-negative bacteria. Methicillin and Oxacillin are penicillin antibiotics that are primarily used to treat gram-positive bacteria, so they can be ruled out. Lincomycin is also used to treat gram-positive bacteria. Carbenicillin, on the other hand, is a type of penicillin antibiotic that is effective against gram-negative bacteria, including Pseudomonas and Proteus.", "answer_choice": "B. Carbenicillin"}
